1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the primary cutting edge of the object, ensuring it has a sharp and dominant shape that is essential for its intended function. This blade will be positioned at the forefront of the object, establishing a solid foundation for the subsequent components to be built around it, enhancing both the aesthetic and practical aspects of the design.

2.description: Next, add the bolster at the base of the blade to enhance the structural integrity of the knife, ensuring a robust connection with the handle. This component not only fortifies the junction where the blade meets the handle, providing stability during use, but also serves to protect the user's hand from slipping onto the blade during cutting tasks.

3.description: Then, attach the guard just below the bolster to provide an essential barrier that protects the user's hand from slipping onto the blade during use. This connection not only enhances safety but also reinforces the structural integrity of the assembly, linking the bolster and blade securely for improved stability.

4.description: Then, add the handle by securely fastening it to the bolster, which provides a comfortable grip for the user while ensuring stability and control during use. This addition is crucial as it completes the main body of the knife, allowing for a seamless transition from the blade through the bolster and guard to the handle, enhancing both functionality and ergonomics.

5.description: Finally, add the butt at the end of the handle to provide a polished finish and enhance the overall balance of the knife. This component not only completes the aesthetic appeal but also offers a secure grip for the user, ensuring that the knife feels stable and comfortable during use.
